course_description: Introduces students to models & methods of practical theology. Explores what it means to do theology in context, attending in particular ways to dynamics of practice, place, culture, and embodiment. Evaluate the capacity of shared practice to engage questions of suffering and injustice. Interdisciplinary in nature, explores texts and perspectives from practical, pastoral, political, and systematic theology; liturgical and ritual studies; religious education; and the social sciences.
